bill_title: revise the elements of the crime of bigamy.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the elements of the crime of bigamy. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-22-15 be amended to read as follows: 22-22-15. Every Any person who, having been while married to another presently living person, marries any other person knowing that he or she is legally married to another presently living person , is guilty of bigamy. This section does not apply or extend to: (1) Any person who was , previously married and , whose husband or wife by that former marriage has been absent for five successive years without being known to be living by such person; (2) Any person who was , previously married and , whose husband or wife by that former marriage has absented himself or herself from his or her such spouse by being outside the United States, continuously for five years; (3) Any person who was , previously married and , whose marriage has been pronounced void, annulled, or dissolved by a competent court ; or (4) Any person, previously married, who believes, in good faith, and has reason to believe, that the previous marriage has been pronounced void, annulled, or dissolved by a competent court . Bigamy is a Class 6 felony.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the elements of the crime of bigamy. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-22-15 be amended to read as follows: 22-22-15. Every Any person who, having been while married to another presently living person, marries any other person, is guilty of bigamy. This section does not apply or extend to: (1) Any person who was previously married and , whose husband or wife by that former marriage has been absent for five successive years without being known to be living by such person; (2) Any person who was previously married and , whose husband or wife by that former marriage has absented himself or herself from his or her such spouse by being outside the United States, continuously for five years; (3) Any person who was previously married and , whose marriage has been pronounced void, annulled, or dissolved by a competent court ; or (4) Any person, presently married, who believes, in good faith, and has reason to believe, that the marriage has been pronounced void, annulled, or dissolved by a competent court . Bigamy is a Class 6 felony. BILL HISTORY 1/19/00 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 135 1/26/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/26/00 Judiciary Do Pass, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 4. H.J. 251 1/27/00 House of Representatives Do Pass, Passed, AYES 56, NAYS 8. H.J. 276 1/28/00 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 245 2/11/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/14/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/14/00 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 6, NAYS 0.
